required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Multiple Attacks Study to Compare the Efficacy and Safety of MK-0974 With Placebo for Acute Migraine (MK-0974-031)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel Group Multiple Attacks Study to Compare the Efficacy and Safety of Oral MK-0974 With Placebo for the Acute Treatment of Migraine With or Without Aura

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to assess the safety and efficacy of telcagepant (MK-0974) in acute treatment of multiple migraine attacks with or without aura. Primary hypotheses of this study are that telcagepant is superior to placebo, as measured by the proportion of participants who have pain freedom, pain relief, pain freedom consistency, pain relief consistency, and absence of photophobia, phonophobia, and nausea at 2 hours post-dose.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pain Freedom at 2 Hours Post-dose (First Migraine Attack)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours post-dose for the first migraine attack (up to 6 months)
primary_outcome.description: Pain Freedom (PF) at 2 hours post-dose (first migraine attack), with pain freedom defined as a reduction in headache severity from Grade 3/2 at baseline to Grade 0 at 2 hours post-dose. Headache severity was subjectively rated by the participant at predefined time points on a scale of Grade 0 to Grade 3: Grade 0 - No pain; Grade 1 - Mild pain; Grade 2 - Moderate Pain; and Grade 3 - Severe Pain.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pain Relief at 2 Hours Post-dose (First Migraine Attack)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours post-dose for the first migraine attack (up to 6 months)
primary_outcome.description: Pain Relief (PR) at 2 hours post-dose (first migraine attack), with pain relief defined as a reduction in headache severity from Grade 3/2 at baseline to Grade 1/0 at 2 hours post-dose. Headache severity was subjectively rated by the participant at predefined time points on a scale of Grade 0 to Grade 3: Grade 0 - No pain; Grade 1 - Mild pain; Grade 2 - Moderate Pain; and Grade 3 - Severe Pain.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pain Freedom Consistency at 2 Hours Post-dose
primary_outcome.description: Pain Freedom Consistency (PFC) at 2 hours post-dose, defined as having achieved PF at 2 hours post-dose on at least 3 treated migraine attacks. Note that for the control groups, a positive PF response arising from the administration of the 1 talcagepant treated migraine attack will count as one of the 3 positive PF responses needed to fulfill the criteria for PFC.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pain Relief Consistency at 2 Hours Post-dose
primary_outcome.description: Pain Relief Consistency (PRC) at 2 hours post-dose, defined as having achieved PR at 2 hours post-dose on at least 3 treated migraine attacks. Note that for the control groups, a positive PR response arising from the administration of the 1 telcagepant treated migraine attack will count as one of the 3 positive PR responses needed to fulfill the criteria for PRC.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Reporting Absence of Photophobia at 2 Hours Post-dose (First Migraine Attack)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours post-dose for the first migraine attack (up to 6 months)
primary_outcome.description: The participant recorded whether photophobia (sensitivity to light) was present or absent at each of the predefined time points.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Reporting Absence of Phonophobia at 2 Hours Post-dose (First Migraine Attack)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours post-dose for the first migraine attack (up to 6 months)
primary_outcome.description: The participant recorded whether phonophobia (sensitivity to sound) was present or absent at each of the predefined time points.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Reporting Absence of Nausea 2 Hours Post-dose (First Migraine Attack)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours post-dose for the first migraine attack (up to 6 months)
primary_outcome.description: The participant recorded whether nausea was present or absent at each of the predefined time points.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Experiencing an Adverse Event (AE) Within 48 Hours Post-dose (First Migraine Attack)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hours post-dose for the first migraine attack (up to 6 months)
primary_outcome.description: AEs were reported following treatment for the first migraine attack using a 48-hour post-dose window. AEs displayed are those reported by at least 4 participants in one or more treatment groups.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Discontinuing Study Medication Due to an AE
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to the 4th dose of study medication (up to 6 months)
primary_outcome.description: Participants discontinuing study medication due to an AE were reported for all migraine attacks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Reporting Sustained Pain Freedom From 2 to 24 Hours Post-dose (First Migraine Attack)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 2 to 24 hours post-dose for the first migraine attack (up to 6 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Sustained Pain Freedom (SPF) from 2 to 24 hours after study medication administration. SPF from 2 to 24 hours post-dose is defined as PF at 2 hours, with no administration of either rescue medication or the optional second dose and with no occurrence thereafter of a mild/moderate/severe headache during the 2 to 24 hours after dosing with the study medication.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Reporting Sustained Pain Freedom From 2 to 48 Hours Post-dose (First Migraine Attack)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 2 to 48 hours post-dose for the first migraine attack (up to 6 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Sustained Pain Freedom (SPF) from 2 to 48 hours post-dose after study medication administration. SPF from 2 to 48 hours post-dose is defined as PF at 2 hours, with no administration of either rescue medication or the optional second dose and with no occurrence thereafter of a mild/moderate/severe headache during the 2 to 48 hours after dosing with the study medication.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Reporting Total Migraine Freedom at 2 Hours Post-dose (First Migraine Attack)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours post-dose for the first migraine attack (up to 6 months)
secondary_outcome.description: TMF 2 hours post-dose, which is defined as TMF at 2 hours post-dose, with no administration of either rescue medication or the optional second dose and with no occurrence thereafter of a mild/moderate/severe headache and no reported occurrence of photophobia, phonophobia, nausea, or vomiting during the 2 hours after dosing with the study medication.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Reporting Total Migraine Freedom From 2 to 24 Hours Post-dose (First Migraine Attack)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 2 to 24 hours post-dose for the first migraine attack (up to 6 months)
secondary_outcome.description: TMF from 2 to 24 hours post-dose, which is defined as TMF at 2 hours post-dose, with no administration of either rescue medication or the optional second dose and with no occurrence thereafter of a mild/moderate/severe headache and no reported occurrence of photophobia, phonophobia, nausea, or vomiting during the 2 to 24 hours after dosing with the study medication.

arm_group.description: Telcagepant 140 mg, oral, tablet, across 4 migraine attacks. For migraine attack 1 only, if no headache relief is obtained after 2 hours post dose, or if the migraine recurs after 2 hours of the initial treatment, participants may receive an optional second dose of telcagepant 140 mg or placebo.

Telcagepant 280 mg, oral, tablet, across 4 migraine attacks. For migraine attack 1 only, if no headache relief is obtained after 2 hours post dose, or if the migraine recurs after 2 hours of the initial treatment, participants may receive an optional second dose of telcagepant 280 mg or placebo.

Placebo, oral, tablet, across 3 migraine attacks (1st, 2nd, and 4th). Telcagepant 140 mg will be administered for the 3rd migraine attack. Participants will receive placebo for the optional second dose. For migraine attacks 2, 3, and 4, no study medication will be provided as an optional second dose.

Placebo, oral, tablet, across 3 migraine attacks (1st, 2nd, and 3rd). Telcagepant 140 mg will be administered for the 4th migraine attack. Participants will receive placebo for the optional second dose. For migraine attacks 2, 3, and 4, no study medication will be provided as an optional second dose.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- History of migraines within the past year
- 1 to 8 moderate or severe migraine attacks per month in the past 2 months that lasted between 4 to 72 hours if untreated
- Use acceptable contraception throughout the study
- Able to complete the study questionnaire(s) and paper diary
- Limit consumption of grapefruit juice to no more than one 8 ounce glass a day
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or breast-feeding or is expecting to become pregnant during the study
- Difficulty distinguishing his/her migraine attacks from tension or interval headaches
- A history of mostly mild migraine attacks or migraines that usually resolve spontaneously in less than 2 hours
- More than 15 headache-days per month or has taken medication for acute headache on more than 10 days a month in the past 3 months
- Greater than 50 years old at the age of migraine onset
- Previously taken telcagepant

clinical_study.keyword: multiple attacks of moderate to severe migraine headaches

group.title: Telcagepant 140 mg
group.description: Telcagepant 140 mg, oral, across 4 migraine attacks. For migraine attack 1 only, if no headache relief is obtained after 2 hours post dose, or if the migraine recurs after 2 hours of the initial treatment, participants may receive an optional second dose of telcagepant 140 mg or placebo.

group.title: Telcagepant 280 mg
group.description: Telcagepant 280 mg, oral, across 4 migraine attacks. For migraine attack 1 only, if no headache relief is obtained after 2 hours post dose, or if the migraine recurs after 2 hours of the initial treatment, participants may receive an optional second dose of telcagepant 280 mg or placebo.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: The placebo group is comprised of Control Group 1 and Control Group 2. Control Group 1 receives placebo across 3 migraine attacks (1st, 2nd, and 4th) and telcagepant 140 mg for the 3rd migraine attack. Control Group 2 receives placebo across 3 migraine attacks (1st, 2nd, and 3rd) and telcagepant 140 mg for the 4th migraine attack. For both groups for migraine attacks 2, 3, and 4, no study medication will be provided as an optional second dose.

group.description: Telcagepant 140 mg, oral, across 4 migraine attacks. For migraine attack 1 only, if no headache relief is obtained after 2 hours post dose, or if the migraine recurs after 2 hours of the initial treatment, participants may receive an optional second dose of telcagepant 140 mg or placebo.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pain Freedom at 2 Hours Post-dose (First Migraine Attack)
outcome.description: Pain Freedom (PF) at 2 hours post-dose (first migraine attack), with pain freedom defined as a reduction in headache severity from Grade 3/2 at baseline to Grade 0 at 2 hours post-dose. Headache severity was subjectively rated by the participant at predefined time points on a scale of Grade 0 to Grade 3: Grade 0 - No pain; Grade 1 - Mild pain; Grade 2 - Moderate Pain; and Grade 3 - Severe Pain.
outcome.time_frame: 2 hours post-dose for the first migraine attack (up to 6 months)
outcome.population: The full-analysis set (FAS) included participants treated that migraine attack, and had both a baseline value and at least 1 post-dose efficacy measurement for pain severity prior to, or including, the 2-hour time point. Participants were excluded from this analysis who did not have a baseline pain score or post-dose data through 2 hours.

analysis.method_desc: Computed using a logistic regression model adjusting for geographic region, baseline migraine severity, and age.
analysis.estimate_desc: An odds ratio >1 is in favor of the first treatment group of the corresponding pairwise comparison.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pain Freedom Consistency at 2 Hours Post-dose
outcome.description: Pain Freedom Consistency (PFC) at 2 hours post-dose, defined as having achieved PF at 2 hours post-dose on at least 3 treated migraine attacks. Note that for the control groups, a positive PF response arising from the administration of the 1 talcagepant treated migraine attack will count as one of the 3 positive PF responses needed to fulfill the criteria for PFC.
outcome.population: The modified FAS (MFAS) Population consisted of all participants who experienced at least either 2 failures or 3 successes, regardless of whether or not they had data for 4 migraine attacks, and recorded baseline severity for at least 1 of the treated migraine attacks.

analysis.estimate_desc: An odds ratio >1 is in favor of the first treatment group of the corresponding pairwise comparison.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Experiencing an Adverse Event (AE) Within 48 Hours Post-dose (First Migraine Attack)
outcome.description: AEs were reported following treatment for the first migraine attack using a 48-hour post-dose window. AEs displayed are those reported by at least 4 participants in one or more treatment groups.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hours post-dose for the first migraine attack (up to 6 months)
outcome.population: The All-Patients-as-Treated (APaT) Population consisted of all participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication and were included in the treatment group according to the medication actually received. If a participant took an unassigned study medication for the first migraine attack, they were included in that treatment group.

group.title: Telcagepant 140 mg
group.description: Participants who received at least one dose of telcagepant 140 mg.

group.title: Telcagepant 280 mg
group.description: Participants who received at least one dose of telcagepant 280 mg.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants who received at least one dose of placebo.

measure.title: Number of Participants Experiencing an Adverse Event (AE) Within 48 Hours Post-dose (First Migraine Attack)
measure.description: AEs were reported following treatment for the first migraine attack using a 48-hour post-dose window. AEs displayed are those reported by at least 4 participants in one or more treatment groups.
measure.population: The All-Patients-as-Treated (APaT) Population consisted of all participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication and were included in the treatment group according to the medication actually received. If a participant took an unassigned study medication for the first migraine attack, they were included in that treatment group.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Discontinuing Study Medication Due to an AE
outcome.description: Participants discontinuing study medication due to an AE were reported for all migraine attacks.
outcome.time_frame: Up to the 4th dose of study medication (up to 6 months)
outcome.population: The APaT Population consisted of all participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication and were included in the treatment group according to the medication actually received. If a participant took an unassigned study medication, they were included in that treatment group.

group.title: Telcagepant 140 mg
group.description: Participants who received at least one dose of telcagepant 140 mg.

group.title: Telcagepant 280 mg
group.description: Participants who received at least one dose of telcagepant 280 mg.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants who received at least one dose of placebo.

measure.title: Number of Participants Discontinuing Study Medication Due to an AE
measure.description: Participants discontinuing study medication due to an AE were reported for all migraine attacks.
measure.population: The APaT Population consisted of all participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication and were included in the treatment group according to the medication actually received. If a participant took an unassigned study medication, they were included in that treatment group.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Reporting Sustained Pain Freedom From 2 to 24 Hours Post-dose (First Migraine Attack)
outcome.description: Sustained Pain Freedom (SPF) from 2 to 24 hours after study medication administration. SPF from 2 to 24 hours post-dose is defined as PF at 2 hours, with no administration of either rescue medication or the optional second dose and with no occurrence thereafter of a mild/moderate/severe headache during the 2 to 24 hours after dosing with the study medication.
outcome.time_frame: From 2 to 24 hours post-dose for the first migraine attack (up to 6 months)
outcome.population: The FAS Population was participants treated that migraine attack, and had both a baseline value and at least 1 post-dose efficacy measurement for pain severity prior to, or including, the 2-hr. time point. Participants were excluded from this analysis for not having a baseline pain score, post-dose data through 24 hrs, or a recurrence question.

group.title: Telcagepant 140 mg
group.description: Telcagepant 140 mg, oral, across 4 migraine attacks. For migraine attack 1 only, if no headache relief is obtained after 2 hours post dose, or if the migraine recurs after 2 hours of the initial treatment, participants may receive an optional second dose of telcagepant 140 mg or placebo.

group.title: Telcagepant 280 mg
group.description: Telcagepant 280 mg, oral, across 4 migraine attacks. For migraine attack 1 only, if no headache relief is obtained after 2 hours post dose, or if the migraine recurs after 2 hours of the initial treatment, participants may receive an optional second dose of telcagepant 280 mg or placebo.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: The placebo group is comprised of Control Group 1 and Control Group 2. Control Group 1 receives placebo across 3 migraine attacks (1st, 2nd, and 4th) and telcagepant 140 mg for the 3rd migraine attack. Control Group 2 receives placebo across 3 migraine attacks (1st, 2nd, and 3rd) and telcagepant 140 mg for the 4th migraine attack. For both groups for migraine attacks 2, 3, and 4, no study medication will be provided as an optional second dose.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Reporting Sustained Pain Freedom From 2 to 24 Hours Post-dose (First Migraine Attack)

Participants were excluded from this analysis for not having a baseline pain score, post-dose data through 24 hrs, or a recurrence question.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Reporting Total Migraine Freedom at 2 Hours Post-dose (First Migraine Attack)
outcome.description: TMF 2 hours post-dose, which is defined as TMF at 2 hours post-dose, with no administration of either rescue medication or the optional second dose and with no occurrence thereafter of a mild/moderate/severe headache and no reported occurrence of photophobia, phonophobia, nausea, or vomiting during the 2 hours after dosing with the study medication.
outcome.time_frame: 2 hours post-dose for the first migraine attack (up to 6 months)
outcome.population: The FAS Population included participants treated that migraine attack, and had both a baseline value and at least 1 post-dose efficacy measurement for pain severity prior to, or including, the 2-hour time point. Participants were excluded from this analysis who did not have a baseline pain score or post-dose data through 2 hours.

group.title: Telcagepant 140 mg
group.description: Telcagepant 140 mg, oral, across 4 migraine attacks. For migraine attack 1 only, if no headache relief is obtained after 2 hours post dose, or if the migraine recurs after 2 hours of the initial treatment, participants may receive an optional second dose of telcagepant 140 mg or placebo.

group.title: Telcagepant 280 mg
group.description: Telcagepant 280 mg, oral, across 4 migraine attacks. For migraine attack 1 only, if no headache relief is obtained after 2 hours post dose, or if the migraine recurs after 2 hours of the initial treatment, participants may receive an optional second dose of telcagepant 280 mg or placebo.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: The placebo group is comprised of Control Group 1 and Control Group 2. Control Group 1 receives placebo across 3 migraine attacks (1st, 2nd, and 4th) and telcagepant 140 mg for the 3rd migraine attack. Control Group 2 receives placebo across 3 migraine attacks (1st, 2nd, and 3rd) and telcagepant 140 mg for the 4th migraine attack. For both groups for migraine attacks 2, 3, and 4, no study medication will be provided as an optional second dose.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The sponsor must have the opportunity to review all proposed abstracts, manuscripts, or presentations regarding this study 60 days prior to submission for publication/presentation. Any information identified by the sponsor as confidential must be deleted prior to submission.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
